exercises.name: Push-Up
exercises.description: A foundational exercise where you lower and raise your body by bending and extending your arms while maintaining a straight body position.

exercises.name: Incline Push-Up
exercises.description: A variation of the push-up performed with your hands on an elevated surface, making it easier to perform, while targeting the upper chest.

exercises.name: Decline Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where your feet are elevated, placing more emphasis on the upper chest and shoulders.

exercises.name: Wide Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where your hands are placed wider than shoulder-width, increasing the focus on the chest muscles.

exercises.name: Clapping Push-Up
exercises.description: An explosive push-up variation where you push yourself off the ground and clap your hands before landing, increasing power and speed.

exercises.name: Diamond Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where your hands are close together underneath your chest, forming a diamond shape, which emphasizes the triceps and inner chest.

exercises.name: Archer Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where you extend one arm out to the side while performing the push-up, placing more emphasis on one side of the chest.

exercises.name: Pseudo Planche Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where your hands are positioned closer to your hips, shifting your weight forward to increase chest and shoulder activation.

exercises.name: Explosive Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where you push off the ground with enough force to lift your hands off the ground, improving explosive strength.

exercises.name: Chest Dips
exercises.description: Using parallel bars, you lower and raise your body while leaning slightly forward, targeting the chest and triceps.

exercises.name: Chest Flyes on Floor
exercises.description: Lying on the floor with dumbbells or bodyweight, you mimic the chest fly motion to engage the chest muscles.

exercises.name: Plyometric Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where you push off the ground explosively, catching air and then landing softly, focusing on power and explosiveness.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where one leg is lifted off the ground, increasing the demand on your core and chest.

exercises.name: Pull-Up
exercises.description: An exercise where you pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, primarily targeting your back muscles.

exercises.name: Inverted Row
exercises.description: Performed by lying underneath a bar and pulling your chest towards it, targeting the upper back muscles.

exercises.name: Chin-Up
exercises.description: A variation of the pull-up with an underhand grip, placing more emphasis on the biceps while still working the back.

exercises.name: Superman
exercises.description: An exercise performed lying face down, where you lift your arms and legs off the ground simultaneously, targeting the lower back.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Row
exercises.description: Using a low bar or TRX straps, you pull your chest up towards the bar while keeping your body straight, engaging the upper back.

exercises.name: Arch Hold
exercises.description: Lying face down, you lift your chest and legs off the ground and hold the position, targeting the lower back and glutes.

exercises.name: Pike Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where you raise your hips high and bend your elbows to lower your head towards the ground, emphasizing the upper back and shoulders.

exercises.name: Towel Row
exercises.description: Using a towel draped over a door or bar, you perform a row by pulling yourself up towards the door or bar, engaging the back muscles.

exercises.name: Reverse Snow Angel
exercises.description: Lying face down with arms extended, you move your arms in a snow angel motion while lifting them slightly off the ground, targeting the upper back.

exercises.name: Seal Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where you keep your hands close together and your elbows flared out, emphasizing the upper back and shoulders.

exercises.name: Single-Arm Inverted Row
exercises.description: A more challenging version of the inverted row where you pull yourself up with one arm at a time, increasing the focus on the back.

exercises.name: Plank with Arm Lift
exercises.description: In a plank position, you lift one arm off the ground and hold it, alternating arms to engage the back and core muscles.

exercises.name: Reverse Plank
exercises.description: Sitting with legs extended and hands behind you, you lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels, targeting the back and glutes.

exercises.name: Pike Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where your hips are raised high, resembling an upside-down V, focusing on the shoulders.

exercises.name: Handstand Push-Up
exercises.description: An advanced exercise where you perform a push-up while in a handstand position, heavily targeting the shoulder muscles.

exercises.name: Arm Circles
exercises.description: A simple exercise where you rotate your arms in small circles, helping to warm up and strengthen the shoulder muscles.

exercises.name: Plank to Downward Dog
exercises.description: An exercise that transitions from a plank to a downward dog position, engaging the shoulders and core.

exercises.name: Shoulder Tap
exercises.description: In a plank position, tap one shoulder with the opposite hand, alternating sides, to engage the shoulders and core.

exercises.name: Reverse Plank
exercises.description: Sitting with legs extended and hands behind you, you lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels, targeting the shoulders and glutes.

exercises.name: Wall Walk
exercises.description: Starting in a push-up position with your feet against the wall, walk your feet up the wall and your hands towards it, then walk back down, focusing on shoulder strength and stability.

exercises.name: Scorpion Stretch
exercises.description: Lying face down, you lift one leg and cross it over your body towards the opposite side, stretching and engaging the shoulders and core.

exercises.name: Downward Dog to Plank
exercises.description: From the downward dog position, transition into a plank position and back, engaging the shoulders and core throughout the movement.

exercises.name: T-Plank
exercises.description: From a plank position, rotate your body to one side and extend the top arm towards the ceiling, alternating sides to engage the shoulders and core.

exercises.name: Shoulder Bridge
exercises.description: Lying on your back with knees bent and feet flat, lift your hips towards the ceiling while pushing your shoulders into the ground, engaging the shoulders and glutes.

exercises.name: Y-T-W-L Raises
exercises.description: Lying face down, raise your arms to form a Y, T, W, and L shape, targeting different parts of the shoulder muscles and improving shoulder stability.

exercises.name: Bear Crawl
exercises.description: Crawl on all fours with hips slightly elevated, moving forward and backward to engage the shoulders, core, and legs.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Bicep Curl
exercises.description: Using a bar or TRX straps, you curl your body towards your hands while keeping your elbows close to your sides, targeting the biceps.

exercises.name: Isometric Bicep Hold
exercises.description: An exercise where you hold your body in a halfway pull-up position, engaging the biceps for an extended period.

exercises.name: Towel Curl
exercises.description: Using a towel looped around an object, you simulate a curling motion, focusing on bicep engagement.

exercises.name: Chin-Up
exercises.description: A variation of the pull-up with an underhand grip, placing more emphasis on the biceps while still working the back.

exercises.name: Negative Chin-Up
exercises.description: A chin-up variation where you focus on the downward phase, slowly lowering your body to increase bicep strength.

exercises.name: Commando Plank
exercises.description: From a plank position, you transition to a forearm plank and back, engaging the biceps along with the core.

exercises.name: Australian Pull-Up
exercises.description: An inclined pull-up variation performed with your body parallel to the ground, targeting the biceps and upper back.

exercises.name: Doorway Curl
exercises.description: Using a door frame, place your hands on the top of the frame and simulate a curling motion by pulling your body upwards.

exercises.name: Resistance Band Bicep Curl
exercises.description: Standing on a resistance band, curl your hands towards your shoulders, focusing on the biceps.

exercises.name: Bicep Flex
exercises.description: An isometric hold where you flex your biceps and hold the contraction for a set period, enhancing bicep endurance.

exercises.name: Incline Bodyweight Curl
exercises.description: Using an inclined surface, you perform a curling motion by pulling your body towards the surface, engaging the biceps.

exercises.name: Towel Row
exercises.description: Using a towel looped around a sturdy object, perform a rowing motion to target the biceps and back.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Hammer Curl
exercises.description: Perform a curl with a neutral grip, simulating a hammer curl with bodyweight exercises to target the biceps and forearms.

exercises.name: Tricep Dip
exercises.description: Performed on parallel bars or a bench, this exercise involves lowering and raising your body to work the triceps.

exercises.name: Diamond Push-Up
exercises.description: A variation of the push-up where your hands are placed close together, forming a diamond shape, emphasizing the triceps.

exercises.name: Bench Dip
exercises.description: A variation of the tricep dip performed on a bench, making it accessible for beginners while targeting the triceps.

exercises.name: Close-Grip Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where your hands are placed close together underneath your shoulders, focusing on the triceps.

exercises.name: Overhead Tricep Extension
exercises.description: In a seated or standing position, extend your arms overhead and lower a weight or object behind your head, targeting the triceps.

exercises.name: Tricep Kickback
exercises.description: Bending over with a straight back, extend your arm behind you while holding a weight or resistance band, focusing on the triceps.

exercises.name: Reverse Plank
exercises.description: Sitting on the floor with legs extended and hands behind you, lift your hips to create a straight line from your shoulders to your heels, engaging the triceps.

exercises.name: Close-Grip Bench Dip
exercises.description: A bench dip variation with hands placed close together, increasing the focus on the triceps.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Skull Crusher
exercises.description: Lying on your back, use a bar or bodyweight to simulate a skull crusher motion, lowering the weight towards your forehead and extending back up to target the triceps.

exercises.name: Decline Diamond Push-Up
exercises.description: A more challenging version of the diamond push-up with your feet elevated, increasing the emphasis on the triceps.

exercises.name: Tricep Pulse Push-Up
exercises.description: In a push-up position, perform small pulses at the bottom of the push-up, increasing time under tension for the triceps.

exercises.name: Tricep Bench Press
exercises.description: Lying on a bench, press your hands down while keeping your elbows close to your sides, targeting the triceps.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Bench Dip
exercises.description: A variation of the bench dip performed with one leg extended or elevated, adding difficulty and focusing more on the triceps.

exercises.name: Lunge
exercises.description: A single-leg exercise where you step forward and lower your hips until both knees are bent at about 90 degrees, targeting the quads.

exercises.name: Step-Up
exercises.description: Performed by stepping onto an elevated surface with one foot and bringing the other foot up to meet it, primarily working the quads.

exercises.name: Jump Squat
exercises.description: A squat variation where you explosively jump at the top of the movement, increasing intensity and engaging the quads.

exercises.name: Wall Sit
exercises.description: An isometric exercise where you hold a seated position against a wall, focusing on the quads.

exercises.name: Pistol Squat
exercises.description: A challenging single-leg squat where you extend one leg forward while lowering your body on the other leg, heavily targeting the quads.

exercises.name: Curtsy Lunge
exercises.description: A lunge variation where you step one leg behind and across the other, lowering your body into a curtsy position, targeting the quads and glutes.

exercises.name: Skater Jumps
exercises.description: An explosive lateral movement where you jump from side to side, mimicking a skating motion, engaging the quads and improving agility.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.description: A single-leg squat with the rear leg elevated on a bench, increasing the range of motion and emphasizing the quads.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Squat to Chair
exercises.description: A variation of the pistol squat where you squat down to a chair or bench, allowing for a controlled movement and emphasizing the quads.

exercises.name: Sissy Squat
exercises.description: A challenging squat variation where you lean back while keeping your knees over your toes, focusing intensely on the quads.

exercises.name: Side Lunge
exercises.description: A lateral movement where you step to the side and squat down, targeting the inner and outer quads.

exercises.name: Reverse Lunge
exercises.description: A variation of the lunge where you step backward instead of forward, engaging the quads as you lower and raise your body.

exercises.name: Box Jump
exercises.description: An explosive exercise where you jump onto a sturdy elevated surface, focusing on the quads and improving lower body power.

exercises.name: High Knees
exercises.description: A cardio exercise where you run in place, lifting your knees as high as possible, engaging the quads and increasing heart rate.

exercises.name: Broad Jump
exercises.description: An explosive jump forward from a standing position, focusing on the quads and improving lower body strength.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Glute Bridge
exercises.description: An exercise where you perform a glute bridge on one leg, increasing hamstring and glute engagement.

exercises.name: Nordic Hamstring Curl
exercises.description: A challenging bodyweight exercise where you lower your body forward from a kneeling position, focusing on the hamstrings.

exercises.name: Sliding Leg Curl
exercises.description: Using a towel or sliders, you curl your legs while lying on your back, targeting the hamstrings.

exercises.name: Hamstring Walk-Out
exercises.description: From a glute bridge position, you slowly walk your feet out and then back in, engaging the hamstrings throughout the movement.

exercises.name: Bridge March
exercises.description: Perform a standard glute bridge, and then lift one foot off the ground and alternate, targeting the hamstrings and glutes.

exercises.name: Reverse Plank
exercises.description: From a seated position, lift your hips off the ground and hold, engaging the hamstrings, glutes, and lower back.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Romanian Deadlift
exercises.description: Balancing on one leg, hinge forward at the hips while keeping your other leg extended behind you, focusing on the hamstrings.

exercises.name: Elevated Hamstring Stretch
exercises.description: While lying on your back, place one leg on an elevated surface and gently stretch the hamstrings by lifting the other leg towards your chest.

exercises.name: Prone Leg Curl
exercises.description: Lying face down, use a towel or resistance band to perform a leg curl motion, focusing on the hamstrings.

exercises.name: Hamstring Bridge
exercises.description: A variation of the glute bridge where you use a towel or resistance band around your feet to provide extra resistance while lifting your hips.

exercises.name: Glute Bridge
exercises.description: Lying on your back, you lift your hips towards the ceiling, targeting the glutes and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Donkey Kick
exercises.description: On all fours, you kick one leg upwards towards the ceiling, focusing on glute activation.

exercises.name: Fire Hydrant
exercises.description: A glute exercise performed on all fours, where you lift one leg out to the side, targeting the outer glutes.

exercises.name: Hip Thrust
exercises.description: An exercise where you lift your hips off the ground while your upper back is supported on a bench, targeting the glutes.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.description: A single-leg squat variation with the rear foot elevated, focusing on the glutes and quads.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Glute Bridge
exercises.description: An advanced version of the glute bridge where one leg is extended, increasing glute and hamstring engagement.

exercises.name: Reverse Lunge
exercises.description: A lunge variation where you step backward instead of forward, targeting the glutes and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Curtsy Lunge
exercises.description: A lunge variation where you step one leg behind and to the side, resembling a curtsy, targeting the glutes and inner thighs.

exercises.name: Frog Pump
exercises.description: Lying on your back with the soles of your feet together and knees out to the sides, you lift your hips towards the ceiling to target the glutes.

exercises.name: Bridge March
exercises.description: From a glute bridge position, you lift one foot off the ground and alternate, targeting the glutes and core.

exercises.name: Elevated Glute Bridge
exercises.description: Perform a glute bridge with your feet elevated on a surface to increase the range of motion and glute activation.

exercises.name: Hip Abduction
exercises.description: Lying on your side, you lift your top leg up and down to target the outer glutes.

exercises.name: Clamshell
exercises.description: Lying on your side with knees bent, you open and close your top knee like a clamshell, targeting the glutes.

exercises.name: Donkey Kick Pulses
exercises.description: Perform the donkey kick exercise but add small, controlled pulses at the top of the movement to increase glute engagement.

exercises.name: Step-Up
exercises.description: Stepping onto an elevated surface with one foot and bringing the other foot up to meet it, primarily targeting the glutes and quads.

exercises.name: Box Jump
exercises.description: An explosive movement where you jump onto a sturdy elevated platform, focusing on the calves and overall lower body power.

exercises.name: Jump Rope
exercises.description: A cardiovascular exercise that involves jumping over a rope, emphasizing the calves and improving overall agility.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Calf Raise
exercises.description: A calf exercise where you raise your heel off the ground on one leg, increasing focus on each calf muscle.

exercises.name: Calf Raise
exercises.description: Standing or seated, you raise your heels off the ground to engage the calf muscles.

exercises.name: Donkey Calf Raise
exercises.description: Bend at the hips and raise your heels while keeping your torso stable, focusing on calf engagement.

exercises.name: Seated Calf Raise
exercises.description: Performed seated, this exercise involves raising your heels while keeping your toes on the ground, targeting the soleus muscle.

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raise with Pause
exercises.description: Perform a standing calf raise and hold the top position for a few seconds to increase muscle engagement.

exercises.name: Calf Raise on Elevated Surface
exercises.description: Stand with the balls of your feet on an elevated surface and perform calf raises to increase the range of motion.

exercises.name: Skipping
exercises.description: Similar to jump rope but with a skipping motion, it emphasizes calf muscle engagement and coordination.

exercises.name: Lateral Calf Raise
exercises.description: Standing on one leg, perform calf raises while keeping your body turned to the side to target the lateral calf muscles.

exercises.name: Bouncing Calf Raises
exercises.description: Perform rapid, small calf raises with minimal movement, focusing on the endurance of the calf muscles.

exercises.name: Toe Taps
exercises.description: Standing with one foot elevated on a low surface, tap the toes of the elevated foot on the surface to engage the calves.

exercises.name: Bench Press
exercises.description: Lying on a bench, you press a barbell up from your chest, mainly targeting the chest muscles.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
exercises.description: Similar to the bench press but performed on an inclined bench, emphasizing the upper chest.

exercises.name: Chest Fly
exercises.description: Lying on a bench with dumbbells, you extend your arms out to the sides and bring them back together, targeting the chest.

exercises.name: Cable Crossover
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, you pull the handles across your body to engage the chest muscles.

exercises.name: Decline Bench Press
exercises.description: Performed on a decline bench, this exercise targets the lower chest muscles.

exercises.name: Pec Deck Machine
exercises.description: A machine-based exercise where you bring your arms together in front of you, focusing on the chest.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Pullover
exercises.description: Lying on a bench, you hold a dumbbell with both hands and move it over your head, targeting the chest and lats.

exercises.name: Push-Up
exercises.description: A bodyweight exercise where you lower and raise your body using your arms, focusing on the chest, shoulders, and triceps.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Squeeze Press
exercises.description: While lying on a bench, you press two dumbbells together above your chest, squeezing the chest muscles throughout the movement.

exercises.name: Smith Machine Bench Press
exercises.description: A variation of the bench press using a Smith machine, which provides more stability and control during the exercise.

exercises.name: Incline Smith Machine Press
exercises.description: Similar to the incline bench press but performed on a Smith machine for increased stability.

exercises.name: Machine Chest Press
exercises.description: A machine-based exercise where you push two handles forward, similar to a bench press, focusing on the chest muscles.

exercises.name: Landmine Press
exercises.description: Using a landmine attachment, you press the barbell up and away from your body, targeting the upper chest.

exercises.name: Cable Incline Fly
exercises.description: Performed on an incline bench with cables, this exercise isolates the upper chest as you bring the handles together in front of you.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
exercises.description: Similar to the bench press but performed with dumbbells, allowing for a greater range of motion and focusing on the chest muscles.

exercises.name: Cable Pec Deck
exercises.description: A machine-based exercise where you perform a fly motion using cables, providing constant tension on the chest muscles.

exercises.name: Chest Press Machine with Neutral Grip
exercises.description: Using a machine that allows a neutral grip, this variation of the chest press focuses on the chest while reducing shoulder strain.

exercises.name: Flat Bench Dumbbell Press
exercises.description: Performed on a flat bench with dumbbells, this exercise targets the chest and allows for a greater range of motion than a barbell bench press.

exercises.name: Cable Standing Chest Press
exercises.description: Using cables in a standing position, you press the handles forward to engage the chest muscles while also working on stability.

exercises.name: Bent Over Row
exercises.description: In this exercise, you bend forward at the waist and row a barbell or dumbbells to your torso, focusing on the back muscles.

exercises.name: Lat Pulldown
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, you pull the bar down towards your chest, targeting the latissimus dorsi.

exercises.name: Deadlift
exercises.description: A compound exercise where you lift a barbell from the ground to hip level, engaging multiple muscle groups, particularly the back.

exercises.name: T-Bar Row
exercises.description: A row variation using a T-bar machine, targeting the mid-back.

exercises.name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Row
exercises.description: Performed with one knee on a bench, you row a dumbbell to your side, focusing on the lats.

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, you pull the handle towards your torso while seated, targeting the back.

exercises.name: Face Pull
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, you pull the rope attachment towards your face, focusing on the rear delts and upper back.

exercises.name: Barbell Row
exercises.description: A variation of the bent-over row performed with a barbell, targeting the entire back.

exercises.name: Pull-Up
exercises.description: A bodyweight exercise where you pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, mainly targeting the lats.

exercises.name: Good Morning
exercises.description: An exercise where you hinge at the hips with a barbell on your back, focusing on the lower back and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Inverted Row
exercises.description: A bodyweight exercise where you pull your chest towards a bar while lying underneath it, targeting the upper back.

exercises.name: Hyperextension
exercises.description: Using a hyperextension bench, you extend your torso up from a bent position, focusing on the lower back.

exercises.name: Wide-Grip Lat Pulldown
exercises.description: A lat pulldown variation with a wider grip, emphasizing the upper lats.

exercises.name: Close-Grip Lat Pulldown
exercises.description: A lat pulldown variation with a close grip, targeting the lower lats.

exercises.name: Rack Pull
exercises.description: A deadlift variation where the barbell is lifted from knee height, focusing on the upper back.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Pullover
exercises.description: An exercise that targets the lats and chest, performed by lying on a bench and moving a dumbbell from above your head to above your chest.

exercises.name: Cable Row with V-Bar
exercises.description: A seated cable row performed with a V-bar attachment to target the middle back and lats.

exercises.name: Reverse Fly
exercises.description: Performed on an incline bench or using cables, this exercise focuses on the rear delts and upper back.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Renegade Row
exercises.description: In a plank position, you row a dumbbell to your side while stabilizing with the opposite hand, targeting the back and core.

exercises.name: Cable Straight Arm Pulldown
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, you pull the bar down in front of you with straight arms to engage the lats.

exercises.name: Chest-Supported Row
exercises.description: Performed on a chest-supported row machine or bench, this exercise isolates the back muscles by reducing lower back involvement.

exercises.name: Smith Machine Bent Over Row
exercises.description: A variation of the bent-over row performed with a Smith machine for increased stability.

exercises.name: Barbell Shrug
exercises.description: Standing with a barbell, you lift your shoulders towards your ears to target the upper traps.

exercises.name: Single-Arm Lat Pulldown
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, you pull one handle down towards your side, focusing on the latissimus dorsi.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Swing
exercises.description: A dynamic movement where you swing a kettlebell between your legs and up to shoulder height, targeting the back and hips.

exercises.name: Shoulder Press
exercises.description: Pressing dumbbells or a barbell overhead while seated or standing, focusing on the shoulder muscles.

exercises.name: Lateral Raise
exercises.description: Holding dumbbells at your sides, you lift them to shoulder height with straight arms, targeting the side delts.

exercises.name: Front Raise
exercises.description: Similar to lateral raises, but you lift the weights in front of you, working the front delts.

exercises.name: Reverse Fly
exercises.description: A rear-delt exercise where you lift dumbbells out to the sides while bent over.

exercises.name: Arnold Press
exercises.description: A variation of the shoulder press where you rotate the dumbbells as you press them overhead, working the entire shoulder.

exercises.name: Cable Lateral Raise
exercises.description: A lateral raise variation using a cable machine to maintain constant tension on the shoulders.

exercises.name: Face Pull
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, you pull the rope attachment towards your face, focusing on the rear delts and upper back.

exercises.name: Upright Row
exercises.description: Pulling a barbell or dumbbells vertically to your chin, targeting the shoulders and traps.

exercises.name: Machine Shoulder Press
exercises.description: A machine-based exercise where you press two handles overhead, similar to a shoulder press, focusing on the deltoids.

exercises.name: Overhead Press
exercises.description: A compound movement where you press a barbell overhead from a standing position, targeting the shoulders.

exercises.name: Push Press
exercises.description: A variation of the overhead press where you use a slight leg drive to help press the barbell overhead, focusing on the shoulders.

exercises.name: Shrug
exercises.description: A simple exercise where you lift your shoulders towards your ears while holding dumbbells or a barbell, targeting the traps.

exercises.name: Landmine Shoulder Press
exercises.description: Using a landmine attachment, you press the barbell upward and away from your body, targeting the shoulders.

exercises.name: Rear Delt Machine Fly
exercises.description: A machine-based exercise where you spread your arms out to the sides, focusing on the rear delts.

exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Press
exercises.description: A shoulder press variation performed while seated, focusing on the deltoids.

exercises.name: Cable Front Raise
exercises.description: A front raise variation using a cable machine to provide continuous tension on the front delts.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Upright Row
exercises.description: A variation of the upright row using dumbbells to target the shoulders and traps.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Cuban Press
exercises.description: A shoulder exercise that combines external rotations with a shoulder press to work the entire deltoid muscle.

exercises.name: Plate Raise
exercises.description: Holding a weight plate with both hands, you lift it directly in front of you to shoulder height, targeting the front delts.

exercises.name: Standing Military Press
exercises.description: A shoulder press performed standing to engage the core and shoulders, using a barbell.

exercises.name: Cable Rear Delt Fly
exercises.description: A rear delt exercise using a cable machine to maintain tension on the rear delts throughout the movement.

exercises.name: Single-Arm Cable Lateral Raise
exercises.description: A unilateral lateral raise using a cable machine to isolate the shoulder muscles.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Front Raise with Twist
exercises.description: A variation of the front raise where you twist your wrists as you lift the weights, engaging the front delts and shoulders.

exercises.name: Cable Overhead Press
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, press the handles overhead to target the shoulder muscles with constant tension.

exercises.name: Bicep Curl
exercises.description: A fundamental exercise where you curl a dumbbell or barbell towards your shoulder, focusing on the biceps.

exercises.name: Hammer Curl
exercises.description: Similar to a bicep curl but with a neutral grip, targeting the biceps and forearms.

exercises.name: Concentration Curl
exercises.description: A seated curl variation where you focus on isolating one arm at a time, targeting the biceps.

exercises.name: Preacher Curl
exercises.description: Performed on a preacher bench, this curl emphasizes the lower part of the biceps.

exercises.name: Cable Curl
exercises.description: A curl variation using a cable machine, providing constant tension throughout the movement.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
exercises.description: Performed on an incline bench, this exercise focuses on the long head of the biceps.

exercises.name: EZ-Bar Curl
exercises.description: A curl using an EZ bar, which allows for a more comfortable grip, targeting the biceps.

exercises.name: Spider Curl
exercises.description: An isolation exercise performed on an incline bench, where you curl a barbell or dumbbell upwards while keeping your upper arms perpendicular to the floor, targeting the biceps.

exercises.name: Zottman Curl
exercises.description: A curl variation where you rotate your wrists at the top of the movement, targeting both the biceps and forearms.

exercises.name: Reverse Curl
exercises.description: A curl variation performed with an overhand grip, emphasizing the brachialis and forearms.

exercises.name: 21s
exercises.description: A curl variation where you perform 21 reps in three different ranges of motion, providing a high-intensity biceps workout.

exercises.name: Barbell Curl
exercises.description: A fundamental curl exercise using a barbell, focusing on the biceps.

exercises.name: Cable Rope Curl
exercises.description: Using a rope attachment on a cable machine, you curl the rope towards your shoulders, targeting the biceps.

exercises.name: Drag Curl
exercises.description: A curl variation where you drag the barbell or dumbbell up your body, focusing on the biceps.

exercises.name: Incline Hammer Curl
exercises.description: A variation of the hammer curl performed on an incline bench, targeting the brachialis and forearms.

exercises.name: Machine Curl
exercises.description: A machine-based curl where you lift the handles towards your shoulders, providing constant tension on the biceps.

exercises.name: Cable Preacher Curl
exercises.description: A preacher curl performed with a cable machine, allowing for continuous tension on the biceps.

exercises.name: Overhead Cable Curl
exercises.description: A curl performed with the cable machine set at a high position, targeting the long head of the biceps.

exercises.name: Single-Arm Cable Curl
exercises.description: A bicep curl performed one arm at a time using a cable machine, which helps to isolate each bicep.

exercises.name: Banded Curl
exercises.description: A bicep curl using resistance bands, which provides variable resistance throughout the movement.

exercises.name: Incline Cable Curl
exercises.description: A curl performed on an incline bench using a cable machine, focusing on the long head of the biceps.

exercises.name: Seated Alternating Dumbbell Curl
exercises.description: Sitting down, alternate between curling each dumbbell towards your shoulder, focusing on bicep isolation.

exercises.name: Reverse Grip Machine Curl
exercises.description: A machine curl variation with a reverse grip, emphasizing the brachialis and forearms.

exercises.name: Skull Crusher
exercises.description: An exercise where you lower a barbell or dumbbells towards your forehead while lying on a bench, targeting the triceps.

exercises.name: Tricep Pushdown
exercises.description: Performed using a cable machine, you push the bar or rope attachment down, focusing on the triceps.

exercises.name: Overhead Tricep Extension
exercises.description: Using a dumbbell or cable, you extend your arms overhead, working the triceps.

exercises.name: Close-Grip Bench Press
exercises.description: A bench press variation with a narrow grip, placing more emphasis on the triceps.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Kickback
exercises.description: With a dumbbell in one hand, you extend your arm behind you while bent over, isolating the triceps.

exercises.name: Cable Tricep Extension
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, you extend your arms downward or overhead, focusing on the triceps.

exercises.name: Dips
exercises.description: A bodyweight exercise where you lower and raise your body using parallel bars, targeting the triceps.

exercises.name: Bench Dips
exercises.description: A variation of dips performed using a bench, where you lower and raise your body, focusing on the triceps.

exercises.name: Diamond Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation where your hands are close together in a diamond shape, emphasizing the triceps.

exercises.name: Tricep Press Machine
exercises.description: A machine-based exercise where you press handles downward, similar to a tricep pushdown, focusing on the triceps.

exercises.name: Overhead Cable Tricep Extension
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, you extend your arms overhead, targeting the long head of the triceps.

exercises.name: Tricep Kickback with Cable
exercises.description: A tricep kickback variation using a cable machine for constant tension, isolating the triceps.

exercises.name: Close-Grip Push-Up
exercises.description: A push-up variation with a close hand placement, emphasizing the triceps.

exercises.name: Reverse Grip Tricep Pushdown
exercises.description: A tricep pushdown variation with a reverse grip, focusing on the upper part of the triceps.

exercises.name: Single-Arm Tricep Pushdown
exercises.description: A tricep pushdown performed one arm at a time using a cable machine, allowing for isolation of each tricep.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Overhead Extension
exercises.description: Holding a dumbbell with both hands overhead, you lower it behind your head and extend it back up, focusing on the triceps.

exercises.name: Tricep Dip Machine
exercises.description: A machine-based tricep dip where you use a machine for added support and adjustability.

exercises.name: Barbell Tricep Extension
exercises.description: A tricep extension using a barbell, either lying on a bench or standing, focusing on the triceps.

exercises.name: Rope Tricep Extension
exercises.description: Using a rope attachment on a cable machine, extend your arms downward to isolate the triceps.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Tricep Extension
exercises.description: Using a kettlebell, perform an overhead extension to target the triceps.

exercises.name: Squat
exercises.description: A fundamental lower body exercise where you bend your knees and hips to lower your body, primarily targeting the quads.

exercises.name: Leg Press
exercises.description: Using a leg press machine, you push a weight away from you with your legs, focusing on the quads.

exercises.name: Leg Extension
exercises.description: An isolation exercise performed on a machine, where you extend your legs from a seated position, targeting the quads.

exercises.name: Front Squat
exercises.description: A squat variation where the barbell is placed in front of your shoulders, emphasizing the quads.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.description: A single-leg squat variation performed with the rear leg elevated on a bench, targeting the quads and glutes.

exercises.name: Hack Squat
exercises.description: A machine-based squat where you push your body up from a lower position, emphasizing the quads.

exercises.name: Sissy Squat
exercises.description: A challenging squat variation where you lean back while bending at the knees, intensely targeting the quads.

exercises.name: Lunges
exercises.description: A dynamic exercise where you step forward and lower your body, targeting the quads and glutes.

exercises.name: Step-Ups
exercises.description: An exercise where you step onto a raised platform with one leg at a time, focusing on the quads and glutes.

exercises.name: Pistol Squat
exercises.description: A single-leg squat variation performed without any equipment, requiring balance and strength, targeting the quads.

exercises.name: Trap Bar Deadlift
exercises.description: Using a trap bar, you perform a deadlift with a more upright torso, placing emphasis on the quads and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Smith Machine Squat
exercises.description: A squat variation using a Smith machine for stability, targeting the quads and glutes.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Press
exercises.description: A leg press variation where you perform the movement one leg at a time, enhancing quad engagement and balance.

exercises.name: Curtsy Lunge
exercises.description: A lunge variation where you step back and across your body, targeting the quads and glutes.

exercises.name: Box Squat
exercises.description: A squat variation where you sit back onto a box or bench before standing up, emphasizing the quads and glutes.

exercises.name: Cable Front Squat
exercises.description: A squat variation performed using a cable machine for added resistance and stability, focusing on the quads.

exercises.name: Isometric Wall Sit
exercises.description: A static hold exercise where you press your back against a wall and squat down until your thighs are parallel to the floor, targeting the quads.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat Jumps
exercises.description: A plyometric variation of the Bulgarian split squat where you add a jump at the end of each rep, increasing intensity and quad activation.

exercises.name: Front Rack Lunge
exercises.description: A lunge variation performed with a barbell held in the front rack position, emphasizing the quads.

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
exercises.description: A squat variation performed while holding a dumbbell or kettlebell at chest height, focusing on the quads and improving squat form.

exercises.name: Deadlift
exercises.description: A compound exercise where you lift a barbell from the ground to hip level, targeting the hamstrings, glutes, and lower back.

exercises.name: Leg Curl
exercises.description: An isolation exercise performed on a machine where you curl your legs towards your body, targeting the hamstrings.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
exercises.description: A deadlift variation focusing on the hamstrings, where you lower the barbell to just below the knees with a slight bend in the legs.

exercises.name: Glute Bridge
exercises.description: Lying on your back, you lift your hips towards the ceiling, targeting the glutes and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Good Morning
exercises.description: An exercise where you hinge at the hips while keeping your back straight, focusing on the hamstrings and lower back.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Deadlift
exercises.description: A unilateral deadlift variation performed on one leg, emphasizing balance and hamstring activation.

exercises.name: Nordic Hamstring Curl
exercises.description: A bodyweight exercise where you lower yourself forward from a kneeling position, focusing on the hamstrings.

exercises.name: Back Extension
exercises.description: Using a back extension machine, you lift your upper body while keeping your lower body stationary, targeting the hamstrings and lower back.

exercises.name: Stiff-Leg Deadlift
exercises.description: A deadlift variation with minimal knee bend, placing more focus on stretching and working the hamstrings.

exercises.name: Swiss Ball Leg Curl
exercises.description: A leg curl variation performed with a Swiss ball, where you curl your legs towards your body while lying on your back.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Swing
exercises.description: A dynamic exercise where you swing a kettlebell from between your legs to shoulder height, targeting the hamstrings, glutes, and core.

exercises.name: Hamstring Walkout
exercises.description: Lying on your back with your feet on a Swiss ball, you walk your feet out and in, engaging the hamstrings throughout.

exercises.name: Cable Leg Curl
exercises.description: A leg curl variation using a cable machine, providing constant tension and targeting the hamstrings.

exercises.name: Standing Leg Curl
exercises.description: Using a standing leg curl machine, you curl one leg at a time while standing, focusing on the hamstrings.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Hamstring Curl
exercises.description: A bodyweight exercise where you curl your legs while lying on your back with your heels on a slippery surface, targeting the hamstrings.

exercises.name: Box Jump to Step-Down
exercises.description: A plyometric exercise where you jump onto a box and step down slowly, engaging the hamstrings during the landing phase.

exercises.name: Isometric Glute-Ham Raise
exercises.description: An isometric hold variation where you lock your feet and maintain a bridge position, focusing on hamstring and glute engagement.

exercises.name: Reverse Hyperextension
exercises.description: Using a reverse hyperextension machine, you lift your legs while lying face down, targeting the hamstrings and lower back.

exercises.name: Sled Drag
exercises.description: Dragging a weighted sled backwards emphasizes hamstring activation as you pull against the resistance.

exercises.name: Hip Thrust
exercises.description: An exercise where you thrust your hips upward while your upper back is supported on a bench, targeting the glutes.

exercises.name: Glute Kickback
exercises.description: Performed on all fours or with a cable machine, you kick one leg back to isolate the glutes.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.description: A single-leg squat variation performed with the rear leg elevated on a bench, targeting the quads and glutes.

exercises.name: Sumo Deadlift
exercises.description: A deadlift variation with a wide stance, placing more emphasis on the glutes and inner thighs.

exercises.name: Glute Bridge
exercises.description: Lying on your back, you lift your hips towards the ceiling, targeting the glutes and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Cable Pull-Through
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, you pull the handle through your legs while hinging at the hips, focusing on the glutes.

exercises.name: Donkey Kick
exercises.description: A bodyweight exercise performed on all fours, where you kick one leg up towards the ceiling, targeting the glutes.

exercises.name: Step-Up
exercises.description: An exercise where you step onto a raised platform with one leg at a time, focusing on the glutes and quads.

exercises.name: Lateral Band Walk
exercises.description: Using a resistance band around your legs, you step side to side to engage the glutes.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Deadlift
exercises.description: A deadlift variation using a kettlebell, emphasizing the glutes and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Glute-Ham Raise
exercises.description: An exercise where you lift your upper body from a prone position using your glutes and hamstrings, often performed on a GHD machine.

exercises.name: Walking Lunges
exercises.description: A dynamic lunge exercise where you step forward and lower your body, alternating legs, and targeting the glutes and quads.

exercises.name: Banded Hip Abduction
exercises.description: Using a resistance band around your knees, you spread your legs apart while lying on your side, focusing on the glutes.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Glute Bridge
exercises.description: A variation of the glute bridge where one leg is lifted off the ground, increasing the intensity on the working glute.

exercises.name: Reverse Lunge
exercises.description: Stepping backward into a lunge, this exercise targets the glutes and quads, with an emphasis on balance.

exercises.name: Hip Abductor Machine
exercises.description: Using a hip abductor machine, you push your legs apart against resistance, focusing on the glutes and outer thighs.

exercises.name: Barbell Glute Bridge
exercises.description: A glute bridge variation with a barbell placed across the hips for added resistance, targeting the glutes and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Cable Glute Kickback
exercises.description: Using a cable machine, you kick one leg back while keeping your torso stable, isolating the glutes with constant tension.

exercises.name: Frog Pumps
exercises.description: Lying on your back with the soles of your feet together and knees apart, you perform hip thrusts to target the glutes.

exercises.name: Sled Push
exercises.description: Pushing a weighted sled across the floor, this exercise engages the glutes, quads, and hamstrings.

exercises.name: Cable Glute Bridge
exercises.description: Performing a glute bridge with a cable machine, you place the cable across your hips for added resistance and focus on the glutes.

exercises.name: Calf Raise
exercises.description: Standing or seated, you raise your heels off the ground to engage the calf muscles.

exercises.name: Seated Calf Raise
exercises.description: Performed on a seated calf raise machine, where you lift your heels while seated, targeting the soleus muscle.

exercises.name: Donkey Calf Raise
exercises.description: A calf exercise where you bend at the hips and raise your heels, providing a stretch in the calves.

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raise
exercises.description: Performed standing, you lift your heels off the ground to engage the calf muscles.

exercises.name: Calf Press on Leg Press Machine
exercises.description: Using a leg press machine, you press with your toes while keeping your legs extended, targeting the calves.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Calf Raise
exercises.description: A calf raise performed on one leg, increasing the difficulty and focus on each calf.

exercises.name: Smith Machine Calf Raise
exercises.description: Using a Smith machine, you perform calf raises with added stability, targeting the calf muscles.

exercises.name: Box Jumps
exercises.description: A plyometric exercise where you jump onto a raised platform, engaging the calves and lower body muscles.

exercises.name: Farmer's Walk on Toes
exercises.description: Walking on your toes while holding weights to enhance calf muscle activation.

exercises.name: Banded Calf Raise
exercises.description: Using a resistance band, you perform calf raises to add resistance and target the calves.

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raise with Dumbbell
exercises.description: Holding a dumbbell in each hand, you perform standing calf raises to increase the load on your calves.

exercises.name: Seated Calf Raise with Barbell
exercises.description: Performed while seated with a barbell resting on your knees, this exercise targets the soleus muscle of the calves.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Calf Raise
exercises.description: Using a kettlebell held in one hand or both, you perform calf raises to engage and strengthen the calf muscles.

exercises.name: Elevated Calf Raise
exercises.description: Standing with your toes elevated on a platform, perform calf raises to increase the range of motion and calf activation.

exercises.name: Sled Push with Toes Elevated
exercises.description: Pushing a weighted sled while standing on an elevated platform, emphasizing calf engagement throughout the push.

exercises.name: Reverse Calf Raise
exercises.description: A variation where you raise the front of your feet, targeting the tibialis anterior muscle along with the calves.

exercises.name: Jump Rope
exercises.description: A cardiovascular exercise involving repeated jumps over a rope, which helps improve calf endurance and strength.

exercises.name: Resistance Band Calf Press
exercises.description: Using a resistance band, you press your toes against the band to perform calf raises, adding resistance.

exercises.name: Stair Calf Raise
exercises.description: Standing on the edge of a step or stair, perform calf raises to increase the range of motion and target the calves.

exercises.name: Bicycle Calf Raise
exercises.description: While seated, extend your legs as if pedaling a bicycle and perform calf raises to engage the calves and improve endurance.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Donkey Calf Raise
exercises.description: A donkey calf raise variation performed on one leg to increase difficulty and isolate each calf muscle.
